decks.notes: This Azorius Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and controlling the game with a mix of disruptive spells and aggressive creatures. By using cards like Founding the Third Path and Helping Hand to generate card advantage and protect your creatures, while also having access to bounce spells like Unsummon to disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with evasive threats like Abhorrent Oculus and finish the game quickly with powerful creatures like Haughty Djinn.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, aiming to apply constant pressure while disrupting their game plan. By efficiently deploying threats and removing opposing threats, the deck seeks to gain an advantage and swiftly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck's mix of creatures and spells provides a versatile toolkit for adapting to different matchups and maintaining momentum throughout the game.

This Boros Control deck focuses on managing the board state and controlling the opponent's resources through a combination of removal spells, powerful creatures, and disruptive enchantments. By utilizing cards like Caretaker's Talent, Get Lost, and Urabrask's Forge, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a win condition with creatures like Realmbreaker and Quintorius Kand. Archangel Elspeth can provide added protection and resilience, while cards like Lightning Helix and Sunfall help to stabilize the player's life total. With a mix of aggression and control elements, the deck aims to out-value and outlast the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells, controlling the board and pressuring the opponent's life total. The deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Spiteful Hexmage and Entity Tracker, along with disruptive spells like Fear of Isolation and Nowhere to Run to keep the opponent on their back foot. The inclusion of cards like Stormchaser's Talent and This Town Ain't Big Enough help to maintain card advantage and provide additional reach to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.
